subject: Simsonn VAM motor may be “dead”
description_text:
Hello, i recently purchased and received a set of Simsonn VAM motors and one of them appear as “dead”. I have switch the motors around to different ports to confirm that the control box isn’t the issue (like SimracingCorner had), and I more then likely believe the motor itself is dead. The way I think this is because when the motor is at 30% strength, it barely works. At this power it is quite strong for the other two motors. And when this “dead” motor is at 100% it is barely noticeable that it moves. At 100% for the other two motors this is enough power to shake my whole rig. I received the pedals and motors two days ago (as of writing this) and the motor worked fine then, but that motor now may be faulty. I’m wondering more so about a single replacement motor or such because I’ve only had the pedals (Plus X) and VAM for two days. Thanks.

Sent from my iPhone

conversations.body_text: Hi Liam Drechsel,    Please provide your order number along with the contact name, phone number, and address. We will send you a replacement VAM.

I ordered off Amazon, not sure how to see order number.
Contact name: Liam Drechsel
Address: 5551 Lori Ln W
City/State: West Fargo, North Dakota 

Sent from my iPhone

>

Is there an update?

Sent from my iPhone

>
Hi Liam Drechsel,    Please provide your postal code; otherwise, we won’t be able to send a replacement.

Yeah it’s 58078. 
 5551 Lori Ln W, West Fargo, North Dakota. ZIP: 58078
Sent from my iPhone

>
Hi Liam Drechsel,  The tracking number is: JSELH0997401385YQ, the shipping carrier is JS EXPRESS, you can track it via https://www.17track.net/en
